The [[anti-trust]] [[class-action]] lawsuit '''Jung v. AAMC ''' alleged collusion to prevent American [[medical resident|trainee doctors]] from negotiating for better working conditions. The [[Medical resident work hours|working conditions of medical residents]] often involved 80- to 100-hour workweeks.[http://archives.cnn.com/2001/HEALTH/06/15/residents.hours/index.html] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060527031017/http://archives.cnn.com/2001/HEALTH/06/15/residents.hours/index.html |date=May 27, 2006 }} The suit had some early success, but failed when the U.S. Congress enacted a statute exempting matching programs from federal anti-trust laws. ==Background== Every year, American medical students and graduates participate along with foreign-trained physicians in a national matching plan to obtain a position in an accredited resident training program. Applicants and programs that participate in the matching plan submit rank-ordered preferences for training. A mathematical algorithm is used to place an applicant in a preferred program that also prefers the applicant. The [[National Resident Matching Program]], also referred to as "The Match", is one of several national matching plans in the United States. ==Lawsuit== The suit was launched on behalf of all current and former medical residents against defendants that oversaw and participated in the matching process as well as institutions that employed medical residents.{{Cite journal| doi = 10.1001/virtualmentor.2015.17.2.hlaw1-1502| volume = 17| issue = 2| pages = 149| last = Weinmeyer| first = Richard| title = Challenging the Medical Residency Matching System through Antitrust Litigation| journal = Virtual Mentor| accessdate = 2016-05-06| date = 2015-02-01| url = http://virtualmentor.ama-assn.org/2015/02/hlaw1-1502.html| deadurl = yes| archiveurl = http://webarchive.loc.gov/all/20150205045900/http://virtualmentor.ama-assn.org/2015/02/hlaw1-1502.html| archivedate = 2015-02-05| df = }} The three physicians who launched the suit alleged that the [[National Resident Matching Program|NRMP Matching program]] was an [[anti-competitive practice]], claiming that: * fourth-year medical students were required to apply to the Match, and had no opportunity to negotiate their terms of employment with teaching hospitals ''(if they did not apply, they could not enter a residency accredited by the [[Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education|ACGME]], and hence could not become certified as physicians by an [[American Board of Medical Specialties|ABMS-recognized board]], meaning that they cannot practice their specialty)'' * the defendants limited the number of residency positions available in U.S. teaching hospitals * the defendants placed "substantial obstacles to the ability of a resident to transfer employment from one employer to another during the period of a residency" * the ACGME encouraged or required participation in the Match as a condition of accreditation for institutions offering residencies. * the defendants shared information on conditions of employment, and reviewed them in order to keep salaries low.[http://www.law.uh.edu/healthlaw/perspectives/%28MT%29Jung3.pdf Jung v. Association of American Medical Colleges: A Special Interest Victory], Miranda W. Turner, University of Houston Law Center,November 2, 2004 The defendants challenged the admissibility of the lawsuit with several arguments, including a lack of jurisdiction [http://www.leagle.com/decision/2004419300FSupp2d119_1407/JUNG%20v.%20ASSOCIATION%20OF%20AMERICAN%20MEDICAL%20COLLEGES] and that the plaintiffs had not been injured.{{Cite journal| doi = 10.1016/S1546-1440(03)00007-3| issn = 1546-1440| volume = 1| issue = 1| pages = 40–47| last = Bierig| first = Jack R.| title = Jung v. Association Of American Medical Colleges: the lawsuit challenging our system of graduate medical education| journal = Journal of the American College of Radiology| accessdate = 2016-05-06| date = 2004-01-01| url = http://www.jacr.org/article/S1546144003000073/abstract}} The court dismissed the cases against two defendants for lack of jurisdiction, and three because the claims of conspiracy did not involve them. The federal district court did allow the case to proceed against 17 defendants, ruling:
... the Court finds that plaintiffs adequately have alleged a common agreement to displace competition in the recruitment, hiring, employment and compensation of resident physicians and to impose a scheme of restraints that has the purpose and effect of fixing, artificially depressing, standardizing and stabilizing resident physician compensation and other terms of employment among certain defendants.
==Legislative change== The lawsuit ended when Congress enacted legislation as a [[Rider (legislation)|rider]] added to an unrelated bill (the [[Pension Funding Equity Act of 2004|Pension Funding Equity Act]]) that exempted participation in a matching program from federal anti-trust laws. The rider was called "Confirmation of antitrust status of graduate medical resident matching programs" (Section 207). Neither the rider nor the then-ongoing Jung v. AAMC case was debated. The rider was lobbied for by the [[Association of American Medical Colleges|AAMC]] and the [[American Hospital Association]], and sponsored by Senator [[Judd Gregg]] of New Hampshire and Senator [[Edward Kennedy]] of Massachusetts. Senators [[Herb Kohl|Kohl]], [[Russ Feingold|Feingold]], and [[Jeff Bingaman|Bingaman]] publicly criticized the way in which the rider was added. The rider praised the 50-year-old Matching Program, saying that "[a]ntitrust lawsuits challenging the matching process, regardless of their merit or lack thereof, have the potential to undermine this highly efficient, pro-competitive, and long standing process" and "would divert the scarce resources of our country's teaching hospitals and medical schools from their crucial missions of patient care, physician training, and medical research" The bill containing the rider was signed into law by President [[George W. Bush]] on April 8, 2004. The new law prohibited "using allegations related to the Match to support any antitrust claim", retroactively. The court ruled that the plaintiff's case was dependent on allegations related to the Match. The case was dismissed under the authority of the new law.{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2004/08/14/us/antitrust-lawsuit-over-medical-residency-system-is-dismissed.html |first=S. |last=Robinson |title=Antitrust Lawsuit Over Medical Residency System Is Dismissed |newspaper=[[New York Times]] |date=August 14, 2004}} ==See also== *[[Medical resident work hours]] *[[National Resident Matching Program]] *[[Match Day (medicine)]] *[[Medical education]] *[http://www.nacua.org/documents/Jung_v_AAMC.pdf ''Jung v. Association of American Medical Colleges et al.,''] [[Case citation|300 F.Supp.2d 119]] ([[United States District Court for the District of Columbia|D.D.C.]] 2004)'' *[[Pension Funding Equity Act of 2004]] § 207, Pub. L. No. 108-218, 118 Stat. 596 (2004) (codified at {{UnitedStatesCode|15|37b}}) ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Medical regulation in the United States]] [[Category:Working time]] [[Category:Medical education]] [[Category:Medical education in the United States]] [[Category:United States labor law]] [[Category:Labor rights]] [[Category:Labor disputes in the United States]] [[Category:Competition law]] [[Category:Law articles needing an infobox]]

'''Lodewijk Constant (Lou) Van Beirendonck''' (born 1960) is a Belgian [[Industrial and organizational psychology|organizational psychologist]], [[management consultant]], and Associate Professor of [[Human resource management]] at the [[Antwerp Management School]], known for his work on [[Competency management system|competence management]].<ref>Forrier, Anneleen, and Luc Sels. "The concept employability: a complex mosaic." International journal of human resources development and management 3.2 (2003): 102-124.</ref><ref>Crutzen, Nathalie, and Didier Van Caillie. "The business failure process: towards an integrative model of the literature." (2007).</ref>
== Biography == Van Beirendonck received his Master in Psychology in 1984 from the [[Katholieke Universiteit Leuven]], his MBA in 1992 from the [[University of Antwerp]], and his PhD in Organizational psychology in 2010 from the [[Tilburg University]].<ref name="HRM-B 2006">''HRM Basisboek 2006 HRM in perspectief''. Kluwer p. xii</ref>
Van Beirendonck started his academic career in 1990 as Executive Professor HRM at the Antwerp Management School, and was Executive Professor at the EHSAL Management School at the [[Hogeschool-Universiteit Brussel]] from 1990 to 2010. Since 2000 he is also Visiting Professor at the [[Vlerick Leuven Gent Management School]]. At the Antwerp Management School since 2010 he is Associate Professor of Human resource management,<ref name="HRM-B 2006"/> and academic director of the master class ‘HR Management’.<ref>[http://gratton.hrsquare.be/nieuws/6947/wie-is-eigenaar-van-de-kennis Wie is de eoigenaar van kennis?] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20131008013206/http://gratton.hrsquare.be/nieuws/6947/wie-is-eigenaar-van-de-kennis |date=2013-10-08 }} at gratton.hrsquare.be. Published 01.07.2011. Accessed 7 October 2013.</ref>
Van Beirendonck has also been executive at the [[Catholic University of Mechlin]] from 2004 to 2010, and had started his own consultancy firm in 1988.<ref name="HRM-B 2006"/>
==Selected publications== Books, a selection: * 1992. ''Dieptezicht in competentiemanagement. Integratie van een modernistische en postmodernistische visie.'' MBA thesis University of Antwerp * 2001. ''Competentiemanagement: the essence is human competence''. Acco, 2001. * 2004. ''Management des compétences: évaluation, développement et gestion''. De Boeck Supérieur. * 2010. ''Handboek HRM: competentiemanagement en arbeidsrecht.'' With Erik Henderickx, Ria Janvier, & Jeroen Lorré (2010). Leuven.
== References == {{reflist|2}}
== External links == * {{nl}} [http://www.standaard.be/cnt/dmf20130621_018 Rekruteren nu en later] at standaard.be
{{Authority control}}

{{Infobox Government agency |agency_name = Ministry of Defence of Azerbaijan |nativename = Azərbaycan Respublikasının Müdafiə Sənayesi Nazirliyi |nativename_a = |nativename_r = |logo = |logo_width = |logo_caption = |seal = Coat of arms of Azerbaijan.svg |seal_width = 120px |seal_caption = Coat of Arms of Azerbaijan |formed = December 16, 2005 |date1 = |date1_name = |date2 = |date2_name = |preceding1 = |preceding2 = |dissolved = |superseding = |jurisdiction = |headquarters = 40, Metbuat Ave. [[Baku]], AZ 1141, [[Azerbaijan Republic]] |employees = |budget = |chief1_name = |chief1_position = |chief2_name = |chief2_position = |chief3_name = |chief3_position = |parent_agency = |child1_agency = |child2_agency = |website = [http://www.mdi.gov.az/?/en/ www.mdi.gov.az] |footnotes = }}
The '''Ministry of Defence Industry of [[Azerbaijan]]''' ({{lang-az|Azərbaycan Respublikasının Müdafiə Sənayesi Nazirliyi}}) is a [[governmental agency]] within the [[Cabinet of Azerbaijan]] in charge of design, manufacturing, regulation and maintenance of products in the fields of defense, radio electronics, instrument engineering.
The Ministry was established on December 16, 2005 by presidential decree. The new Ministry, incorporated the [[State Departments for Military Industry]] and for [[Armaments and the Military Science Center]], each of which was formerly a separate agency within the [[Military of Azerbaijan|Azerbaijani Defense Ministry]].[[Yavar Jamalov]] was in charge of heading this ministry between March 2006 – 23 June 2018. <ref>[https://news.az/articles/politics/131950 Azerbaijani Defense Industry Minister Yavar Jamalov dies. news.az]</ref>
==Background== Azerbaijan has a desire to become a major arms exporter to the [[South Caucasus]], [[Central Asia]] and [[Middle East]]. It was announced in January 2008 that the defence industry of Azerbaijan would begin to manufacture [[armoured personnel carrier]]s and [[infantry fighting vehicle]]s, as well as small calibre artillery guns.<ref>BBC Monitoring Service, APA News Agency,, [http://www.un-az.org/undp/bulnews55/en3.php AZERBAIJAN TO START MANUFACTURING ARMS, MILITARY HARDWARE IN 2008], 26 January 2008</ref> Whether this has actually taken place is unclear. The new ministry is cooperating with the defence sectors of Ukraine, Belarus and Pakistan.<ref>Richard Giragosian, [http://www.rferl.org/featuresarticle/2007/02/2b0bdd2d-49a6-4bff-826d-05edefe4dbdb.html Azerbaijan: Baku Signals New Determination For Defense Reform], RFE/RL, February 01, 2007</ref> In 2008 several more military factories were created in Azerbaijan.
According to Sumarinly, the MDI has been in talks with various [[Israel]]i defense firms and two [[Turkey|Turkish]] companies about the production of an armored vehicle based on the [[Russia]]n [[T-55]] [[tank]]’s chassis. MDI will also provide 30 South-African-designed Matador and Marauder armored vehicles to the army.
[[Image:Day of the Armed Forces of Azerbaijan 2011 (2).jpg|280px]] [[File:Military parade in Baku on an Army Day7.jpg|300px]]
'''Matador and Marauder mine-protected vehicles at the military parade in [[Baku, Azerbaijan]]'''
In March 2011 the MDI presented its prototype of an Austrian-designed four-seater known as the Diamond DA-42 military passenger plane. The plane is assembled by AZAD Systems, an Azerbaijani state-owned firm.<ref>[http://www.eurasianet.org/node/63180 Azerbaijan: Baku Aims to Become Regional Arms Dealer]</ref>
Overall, Azerbaijani military production more than doubled between 2009 and 2010, and the product line expanded by 17 percent, according to MDI.
==Enterprises== Enterprises of the Ministry include:<ref>[http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=97410 Aircraft Repair Plant of Azerbaijan to be reconstructed] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120215042025/http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=97410 |date=2012-02-15 }}</ref> * [[RPE Iglim]], "Avia-Agregat" plant, RPE "Sanayejihaz" ("Prompribor"), RPE "Dalga” and "Alov"plant are the biggest suppliers for aviation and shipbuilding industries. *[[Radiogurashdirma]] ("Radio engineering"), "Azon", "Peyk" and "Computer" plants are manufacturing products for communication means and radio-electronic industry. *[[RPE Neftgazavtomat]], "Telemekhanika" and Baku "Jihazgayirma" (Instrument Engineering) plants are involved in manufacture of devices and automation systems for monitoring technological processes in oil/gas production, refinery and chemical industries. * [[RPE Automatic Lines]] is manufacturing non-standard equipment and products for application in electrotechnical &machine engineering industries. * [[Avia-Agregat]] manufactures multi-purpose aviation equipment, various airdrome conditioners, universal container of board conductor, air-to-air radiators, fuel-oil, air-to-air heat exchangers, ventilators. * [[AZAD Systems]]
==Cooperation== The Ministry’s enterprises co-operate with partners in many foreign countries in following areas: * Aviation * Oil industry * Instrument Engineering * Navigation
Recently, the Turkish firms of ASELSAN and MKEK has signed a deal with Azerbaijan. ASELSAN has been awarded to co-produce monocular night vision sights and thermal scopes (sniper rifles etc.) with Azerbaijan.
Makina Kimya Endüstrisi Kurumu (MKE) has been awarded a contract worth $1.150.000 to produce weapons, ammunition, chemicals and other materials. Besides the contract, MKEK will also take part in the assistance of modernization of the Azeri defense industries.<ref>[http://www.trt.net.tr/Haber/HaberDetay.aspx?HaberKodu=5cec1825-8e7e-4d6c-8e22-d35266d0a30e ASELSAN, Azerbaycan ve Körfez ülkeleri ile ortaklaşa gece görüş sistemleri üretecek. MKE ise Azerbaycan'la silah üretiminde işbirliğine gidecek.]</ref>
Azerbaijani-made prototypes of [[Orbiter 2M]] [[Unmanned aerial vehicle]] are expected to undergo testing for up to two years. Full-scale production won’t begin before 2013, under the existing timetable.<ref name="Abbasov">{{cite web|last=Abbasov|first=Shahin|title=Azerbaijan: Baku Aims to Become Regional Arms Dealer|url=http://www.eurasianet.org/node/63180|publisher=Eurasianet.org|accessdate=29 March 2011}}</ref> Production of drones has started at Azad Systems, a joint venture between Azerbaijan’s Defence Industry Ministry and Israeli manufacturer Aeronautics.<ref name="Smith">{{cite web|last=Smith|first=Mike|title=Orbiter 2 to be built in Azerbaijan|url=http://www.suasnews.com/2011/03/4616/orbiter-2-to-be-built-in-azerbaijan/|publisher=Suas news|accessdate=29 March 2011}}</ref><ref name="Israel Markets UAVs To Moslems">{{cite web|title=Israel Markets UAVs To Moslems|url=http://www.strategypage.com/htmw/htwin/articles/20110317.aspx|accessdate=29 March 2011}}</ref>
===Research Production Enterprise Iglim===
* Multi-purpose Airfield Conditioners: АК-04-9А; АК-1,6-9А * Attendant’s Container KBU 8-10 * Air-to-Air Radiators: VVR 01.7604.5100.00; ** VVR 5.12.7604.0020.00; VVR 2.11.7604.0400.00; * Fuel-Oil Radiators: 5451Т; 5580Т; 5783 Т-1 * Fuel-Oil Heat Exchangers: 6212 Т; 6212Т-01; 6107 Т * Air-to-Air Heat Exchanger 6246 Т * Supercharger 5620 * Dehydrator 2394T * Fans: 5617 Т; 4523 * Air Drier 6011 * Moisture separators: 2227; 6368; 5676А; 2788; 6377; 6917; 6678
On September 27, 2016, the 2nd Azerbaijan International Defence Exhibition “ADEX-2016” was hold at Baku Expo Centre. The “Memorandum of Understanding” was signed between the Minister of Defence Industry Yavar Jamalov and the Minister of Defence Zakir Hasanov during the event. According to the agreement between the parties, the Armed Forces will be supplied with new unmanned aerial vehicles which were produced at the Ministry’s enterprises. The aerial vehicle included reconnaissance and observation drones and new model of “Zarba".<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mdi.gov.az/?/en/news/view/421/|title=Memorandum of Understanding has been signed between the Ministry of Defence Industry and the Ministry of Defence|date=2016-09-27|website=www.mdi.gov.az|language=en|access-date=2018-10-30}}</ref>
The ministry of Defence Industry also cooperates with the following countries in the field of production and modernization of military equipment.
* Israel: modernization and production of military equipment<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.azerizv.az/news/print-4914.html|title=Газета Азербайджанские Известия - Успешное балансирование - Известия Азербайджан - Новости|last=Известия|first=Газета Азербайджанские|website=www.azerizv.az|access-date=2018-10-30}}</ref> * Jordan: Cooperation * Pakistan: the production of aerial bombs and artillery shells of various calibres * Russia: the production of automatic machines. * Turkey: production and modernization of military equipment, cooperation with defence industry enterprises - Aselsan, FNSS, Selex, MKEK and Roketsan<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://aze.az/baku-mogut-zainteresovat-novinki-oboronproma-turtsii.html|title=Баку могут заинтересовать новинки оборонпрома Турции на SAHA EXPO-2018|last=AZE|date=2018-09-13|work=AZE.az|access-date=2018-10-30|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.anl.az/down/meqale/azerizv/azerizv_mart2009/73202.htm|title=Оборонка набирает мощь|website=www.anl.az|access-date=2018-10-30}}</ref> * Ukraine: modernization of military equipment * South Africa: modernization and production of military equipment. * Germany: cooperation with the defence concern Rheinmetall (Protocol of Intent)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mdi.gov.az/?/en/news/view/477/|title=Official website of German magazine|date=2018-07-02|website=www.mdi.gov.az|language=en|access-date=2018-10-30}}</ref>
==Air Force== [[File:Bespilotna letelica Orbiter VS.JPG|300px|thumb|center|Aeronautics Defense Orbiter|Orbiter-2M]] The country also manufactures Israeli-designed spy planes. Among the licensed pilotless spy plane is the [[Aeronautics Defense Orbiter|Orbiter-2M]] and the [[Aerostar]]. Both are manufactured at the government-owned Azad Systems Company plant near Baku.<ref>[http://www.eurasianet.org/node/63004 Azerbaijan's Spying Carpets]</ref><ref>{{cite news |url= http://www.flightglobal.com/articles/2011/03/08/354058/azad-systems-starts-uav-production.html|title=Azad Systems starts UAV production|date=April 8, 2011|publisher="Flightglobal"|accessdate=April 8, 2011}}</ref> The head of the Defense Industry, Yaver Jamalov, said that by the end of 2011 a total of 60 UAVs would be produced.<ref>{{cite news |url= http://anspress.com/index.php?a=2&lng=az&nid=99956|title=Azərbaycan ilin sonuna qədər 60 ədəd pilotsuz təyyarə istehsal edəcək|date=May 11, 2011|publisher="ANS Press"|accessdate=May 11, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=До конца года Азербайджан произведет 60 беспилотников |url=http://www.1news.az/politics/20110511013056874.html |accessdate=12 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110514013846/http://www.1news.az/politics/20110511013056874.html |archivedate=14 May 2011 |df= }}</ref>
==Navy== In May 2011, President of the [[State Oil Company of Azerbaijan Republic]] [[Rovnag Abdullayev]] stated that Azerbaijan will start the production of national warships after 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title=Azerbaijan to produce warships |url=http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=146812 |accessdate=9 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111120063342/http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=146812 |archivedate=20 November 2011 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Azerbaijan to produce ships|url=http://www.news.az/articles/economy/33686|accessdate=9 May 2011}}</ref>
==Current production== [[File:Istiglal.jpg|300px|thumb|center|[[Istiglal Anti-Material Rifle|Istiglal IST-14.5]].]]
In 2008, Azerbaijan revealed the [[Istiglal Anti-Material Rifle|Istiglal IST-14.5]]. An [[anti-material rifle]], which can be taken down into 2 separate components for easy transportation.<ref name="APA">{{cite web|url=http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=101329|title=Azerbaijan’s "Istiglal" rifle becomes interesting for the world|accessdate=2009-07-03|date=2009-04-29|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100217102409/http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=101329|archivedate=2010-02-17|df=}}</ref><ref name="News Report">{{cite web|url=http://www.azerbaijan.az/portal/newsen.html?action=GetFullNews&ldid=2005-07-26&ltid=21:41:54&ndid=2009-04-30&nid=11|title=AZERBAIJAN’S "ISTIGLAL" RIFLE BECOMES INTERESTING FOR THE WORLD|accessdate=2009-07-03|date=2009-04-30}}</ref> The rifle is said to be operable in adverse weather such as rain and dirt with temperature ranges from 50 to -50 degrees Celsius.<ref name="APA"/><ref name="News Report"/> The rifle is operated in several countries. In 2011, Azerbaijan has begun producing [[AK-74M]] assault rifles under a license from the Russian armaments manufacturer [[Izhmash]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Azerbaijan begins AK-74M production|url=http://www.upi.com/Business_News/Security-Industry/2011/07/12/Azerbaijan-begins-AK-74M-production/UPI-47161310488428/|publisher=United Press International|accessdate=12 July 2011}}</ref> The assault rifles are being produced for the Azerbaijani Armed Forces under the name ''Khazri''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Azerbaijan starts production of Kalashnikovs|url=http://news.az/articles/politics/40014|publisher=News.az|accessdate=12 July 2011}}</ref> In addition to production of Istiglal IST-14.5 and AK-74M, Azerbaijan has also been producing the following weapon systems: * IST – 12.7 mm calibre sniper rifle * UP-7.62 submachine gun * ''Inam'', ''Zafar'', and ''Zafar-K'' pistols (jointly with the Turkish [[TİSAŞ]] company) * 7.62×54mmR GPMG to be integrated with tanks and armoured vehicles * ''Qaya-1'' and ''Qaya-2'' RPG-7V2 hand-held anti-tank grenade launchers * 60 mm [[Mortar (weapon)|mortar]] * 82 mm mortar * 107 mm reactive volley-fire system (gate mechanism and missiles) * [[Matador (mine protected vehicle)|Matador]] and [[Marauder (vehicle)|Marauder]] mine-protected armoured vehicles (jointly with the [[Paramount Group]] of South Africa) * iLDIRIM mine-resistant ambush protected vehicle * Small fire arms, munitions for artillery-type weaponry, mines, ''Qigilcim'' mine and bomb clearance system, helmets, ballistic protection, optical devices, collimator, thermal sighting system, multi-spectral covers, dosimeters for submariners and more.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.defpro.com/daily/details/900/?SID=6e27d846e73e6903a13edeacbeaa83a3 |title=The Emanzipation of Azerbaijan’s Defence Industry |accessdate=2011-10-18}}</ref>
==Potential future projects== Murad Bayar, the undersecretary for Turkish Defense Industries, said that Turkey aimed to manufacture new tanks for the Turkish Armed Forces. "Some of these tanks could be manufactured in Azerbaijan, and some can be produced in Turkey, joint production with Azerbaijan in line with this country`s needs in the future." Bayar told.<ref name="azmitup1">[http://www.turkishpress.com/news.asp?id=242528 Azerbaijan May Join Turkey's New Tank Manufacturing Project, Bureaucrat]</ref>
Azerbaijani-made prototypes of Orbiter 2M [[Unmanned aerial vehicle]] are expected to undergo testing for up to two years. Full-scale production won’t begin before 2013, under the existing timetable.<ref name="Abbasov"/> Production of drones has started at Azad Systems, a joint venture between Azerbaijan’s Defence Industry Ministry and Israeli manufacturer Aeronautics.<ref name="Smith"/><ref name="Israel Markets UAVs To Moslems"/>
According to the Azerbaijani APA agency in November 2010, "Azerbaijan is in the negotiations with some other countries on helicopter production." - said by the Minister of Defence Industry of Azerbaijan, [[Yavar Jamalov]]. He also mentioned that recently the Ukrainian Premier Minister offered Azerbaijan joint production of 100 helicopters<ref>[http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=133242 Azerbaijan and Ukraine plan to produce helicopter ] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120325184421/http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=133242 |date=2012-03-25 }}</ref> and it is possible. According to him, the Ministry of Defence Industry of Azerbaijan is in the negotiations with some other countries as well as [[Ukraine]].<ref>[http://www.azadliqradiosu.az/archive/news/20101103/1/1.html?id=2209640 "Azərbaycan helikopter istehsalı ilə bağlı danışıqlar aparır"], Azadliq Radiosu, November 3, 2010</ref>
== Modernization == In 2011, the reconstructed instrument-making plant of the Jihaz Production Association of the Ministry of Defence Industry was opened in Baku.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ru.president.az/articles/1697/print|title=Официальный сайт президента Азербайджанской Республики - НОВОСТИ » Мероприятия Ильхам Алиев принял участие в открытии Бакинского приборостроительного завода Министерства оборонной промышленности|last=President|website=ru.president.az|access-date=2018-10-30}}</ref>
In 2011, production of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) of the Aerostar and Orbiter-2M brands was continued.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://regnum.ru/news/1480785.html|title=Азербайджан приступает к производству беспилотников|work=ИА REGNUM|access-date=2018-10-30|language=ru-RU}}</ref>
In 2016, the industry started its own production of short-range missiles. Approximately 125 types of products are being developed, and projects for creating air-to-ground, air-to-air, and ground-to-ground missiles are being implemented.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://news.rambler.ru/articles/34832560-azerbaydzhan-zamahnulsya-na-ballisticheskie-rakety/|title=Азербайджан замахнулся на баллистические ракеты|work=Рамблер/новости|access-date=2018-10-30|language=ru-RU}}</ref>
On February 14, 2017, there was a demonstration of the national armoured vehicle “Tufan”, which is resistant to mines. About six months was spent for the development of this armoured vehicle.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mdi.gov.az/?/en/news/view/443/|title=Presentation of National Armored Vehicle “Tufan” of the Ministry of Defence Industry has been Performed|date=2017-02-14|website=www.mdi.gov.az|language=en|access-date=2018-10-30}}</ref>
On June 23, 2017, the opening ceremony of a plant for the production of various types of MSGL grenade rounds and 40 types grenade launchers of the Sharg Production Association of the Ministry was held in Shirvan. The main goal of this plant is to organize the production of four types of grenade rounds: fragmentation, cumulative fragmentation, lighting and smoke for 40x46 mm revolving grenade launchers capable of meeting the standards of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mdi.gov.az/?/en/news/view/455/|title=Opening of plant for production of rounds for revolver type grenade launcher of Production Union “Sharg” was held|date=2017-06-23|website=www.mdi.gov.az|language=en|access-date=2018-10-30}}</ref>
The improvement of the Gürzə armoured vehicle continues by attaching new combat modules to it.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.euracom.ru/news/azerbajdzhan-usovershenstvuet-gyurzu/|title=Азербайджан усовершенствует "Гюрзу" - компания Евраком|date=2014-04-14|work=компания Евраком|access-date=2018-10-30|language=ru-RU}}</ref>

{{Infobox Officeholder | name = Péter Zwack | birth_name = Péter Zwack | image = Zwack Peter.jpg | caption = | order = [[Hungary – United States relations|Hungarian Ambassador to the United States]] | term_start = 1990 | term_end = April 1991 | president = | predecessor = [[Péter Várkonyi]] | successor = [[Pál Tar]] | citizenship = [[Hungary|Hungarian]]
American | nationality = [[Hungarian people|Hungarian]] | alma_mater = [[University of Budapest]] (1946-1947)
[[University of Milan]] | known_for = [[CEO]] of [[Zwack]] (1987-2008) | prize = Honorary citizen of [[Budapest]] | board = | networth = | birth_date = {{birth date|1927|5|21|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Budapest]], [[Kingdom of Hungary (1920–1946)|Hungary]] | death_date = {{death date and age|2012|8|5|1927|5|21|df=y}} | death_place = [[Venturina Terme]], [[Italy]] | profession = businessman ([[Zwack]]) | parents = János Zwack
Vera Wahl | spouse = Iris Rogers (1953-1969)
Anne Marshall (1973-2012) | children = Peter
Gioia
Alexa
Iris
John
Sándor
Izabella | party = [[Entrepreneurs' Party]]
[[Alliance of Free Democrats]] |}} {{eastern name order|Zwack Péter János}} '''Péter János Zwack''' (21 May 1927 – 5 August 2012){{cite web|title=Meghalt Zwack Péter|url=http://index.hu/belfold/2012/08/05/meghalt_zwack_peter/|publisher=[[Index.hu]]|accessdate=6 August 2012|language=hu}} was a [[Hungarians|Hungarian]] businessman, investor, philanthropist, diplomat and the Hungarian Ambassador to the [[United States]] from 1990 until 1991. He was the [[CEO]] and owner of the company [[Zwack]]. ==Biography== ===In emigration=== Zwack was born into a prominent family which owned the [[Zwack]] PLC. During [[World War II]] Budapest and the Zwack factory were completely destroyed. After the war, in 1948 the new Communist regime nationalized the factory. The Zwack family fled the country. János Zwack with his son Péter, great grandson of József Zwack, the founder of the factory, was able to escape with the original Zwack recipe in his pocket. Béla Zwack remained behind to give the communist government a "fake" Zwack recipe and went on to become a regular factory worker. Meanwhile, János and Péter migrated to the [[United States]] and after several months in [[Ellis Island]]'s refugee camp were granted US entry purely because they possessed the Zwack recipe. They later settled in the [[Bronx]] in 1949 when Péter was 22 years old. It was in the U.S. that Péter learned all the ins and outs of the spirits industry. Together with [[Tibor Eckhardt]] he founded a charity named ''First Aid for Hungary'' in 1956 which helped the refugees of the [[Hungarian Revolution of 1956]]. ===Political career in Hungary=== Zwack became chairman of the [[Entrepreneurs' Party]] in 1992. Two years later he made an electoral alliance with [[SZDSZ]], [[Fidesz]] and the [[Agrarian Alliance]], according to which he was the joint candidate of the four parties in [[Kecskemét]] during the [[Hungarian parliamentary election, 1994|1994 Hungarian parliamentary election]]. He won a seat to the [[National Assembly of Hungary]] as the only independent MP. He resigned from his party leader position in 1995. Between 1995 and 1997 he was a member of the Kossuth Prize and Széchenyi Prize Committee. During the [[Hungarian parliamentary election, 1998|1998 Hungarian parliamentary election]] he was supported by SZDSZ but he did not repeat his success four years ago. After that he joined to SZDSZ. In 1999 he became a member of the party's leadership. He was one of the party's chargé d'affaires from 2000 to 2003. In 2002 he was elected to a member of the parliament again but he resigned half years later. ===Death=== Zwack died in [[Italy]] on 5 August 2012 at the age of 85. The family business continues on led by his two youngest children, Sándor and Izabella.{{cite web|title=Elhunyt Zwack Péter|url=http://www.napi.hu/tozsdek-piacok/elhunyt_zwack_peter.527392.html|publisher=Napi Gazdaság|accessdate=6 August 2012|language=hu}} ==Personal life== First he married in 1953. His wife was Iris Rogers. Together they had six children: Peter (1954), Gioia (1956), Alexa (1959), Iris (1961) and John (1965). This marriage lasted until 1969. His second wife was Anne Marshall. They married in 1973 and had together a son and a daughter: Sándor (1974) and Izabella (1976).[Szakonyi Péter - A pénz mágusai, Sikeres vállalkozók Magyarországon] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20080603002300/http://www.washdiplomat.com/ambprof/Hungary.html The Washington Diplomat Newspaper - Ambassador profile] *MTI Ki Kicsoda 2009, Magyar Távirati Iroda Zrt., Budapest, 2008, 1225. old., ISSN 1787-288X *[http://www.zwack.hu/head.php Zwack Péter életrajza] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20160304001409/http://www.parlament.hu/kepviselo/elet/z404.htm Zwack Péter 1996-os parlamenti életrajza] *[http://www.parlament.hu/internet/plsql/ogy_kpv.kepv_adat?p_azon=z404&p_ckl=37 Zwack Péter országgyűlési adatlapja] {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{succession box | before=[[Péter Várkonyi]] | title=[[Hungary – United States relations|Hungarian Ambassador to the United States]] | years=1990–1991| after=[[Pál Tar]]}} {{s-end}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zwack, Peter}} [[Category:1927 births]] [[Category:2012 deaths]] [[Category:Alliance of Free Democrats politicians]] [[Category:Hungarian diplomats]] [[Category:Hungarian emigrants to the United States]] [[Category:Hungarian businesspeople]] [[Category:Ambassadors of Hungary to the United States]] [[Category:Hungary–United States relations]] [[Category:Members of the National Assembly of Hungary (1994–98)]] [[Category:Members of the National Assembly of Hungary (2002–06)]]

{{Infobox person | image = File:Rolf Theiler.jpg |caption=Rolf Theiler in Zurich, Switzerland | name = Rolf Theiler | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=y|1957|11|05}} | nationality = Swiss | alma_mater = [[SBS Swiss Business School]] | occupation = {{flat list| *[[Entrepreneur]] *[[Philanthropist]] }} | birth_name = Rolf Theiler | residence = [[Zug, Switzerland]]
[[Cape Town, South Africa]] | known_for = {{unbulleted list|[[Chairman]] & [[Corporate title|President]] of [[Laureus World Sports Awards|Laureus Foundation]][[ISO 3166-1 alpha-2|CH]] {{cite web |url=http://www.mercedes-csi.ch/en-rolf-theiler.phtml |title=Mercedes-CSI 24.01. - 26.01. 2014 - Zürich Hallenstadion - FEI World Cup |publisher=Mercedes-csi.ch |date=1957-11-05 |accessdate=2014-08-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140825231011/http://www.mercedes-csi.ch/en-rolf-theiler.phtml |archivedate=2014-08-25 |df= }}|[[Entrepreneur|Founder]] & [[Concurrent estate|Co-owner]] of Mercedes CSI}} | spouse = {{marriage|Gloria Theiler|2004}} |relatives= {{plain list}} * [[Errol Arendz]] (brother in law) https://city-press.news24.com/News/Shrine-to-a-porn-star-sells-for-R99m-20150704 | home_town = [[Zurich, Switzerland]] }} '''Rolf Theiler''' (born November 5, 1957) is a [[Swiss people|Swiss]] [[entrepreneur]] and [[philanthropist]]. He is the [[Entrepreneur|founder]] and [[Concurrent estate|co-owner]] of [[Mercedes Benz|Mercedes CSI]]{{cite web|url=http://www.tagesanzeiger.ch/sport/weitere/Der-CSI-Zuerich-war-immer-ein-Trendsetter/story/28995733 |title="Der CSI Zürich war immer ein Trendsetter" - News Sport: Weitere |publisher=tagesanzeiger.ch |date=2010-01-27 |accessdate=2014-08-26}} and chairman and president of [[Laureus World Sports Awards|Laureus Foundation Switzerland]].{{cite web|url=http://www.laureus.com/content/trustees |title=Trustees |publisher=Laureus |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}} Theiler is also the former [[Concurrent estate|co-owner]] and [[chairman]] of BVG Management.{{cite web|url=http://www.bvgverwaltung.ch/uber-uns/leitbild/ |title=BVG Verwaltung :: Leitbild |publisher=Bvgverwaltung.ch |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}}{{cite web|author=Von Werner Schneiter |url=http://www.affolteranzeiger.ch/aktuell/news-detailansicht/?tx_ttnews%5Btt_news%5D=12742&cHash=fccb27614ab129e09eb1683a7f1560f1 |title=Anzeiger Bezirk Affoltern: "Hochleistungssport und Show – das ist unser Erfolgsrezept" |publisher=Affolteranzeiger.ch |date=2012-01-23 |accessdate=2014-08-26}} ==Background & Career== Rolf Theiler was born in [[Zurich, Switzerland]] in 1957, he is the youngest of 3 children and his father, Georges Theiler was an [[architect]] by trade. Theiler attended [[SBS Swiss Business School]] in [[Zurich]] but then left to focus on his professional show jumping career. After which point he took over his father's business, BVG Management together with his older brother, Urs Theiler. ==BVG Verwaltung== BVG Management is a [[Real estate investing|property investment firm]] headquartered in [[Thalwil]].{{cite web|url=http://www.bvgverwaltung.ch/kontakt/ |title=BVG Verwaltung :: Kontakt |publisher=Bvgverwaltung.ch |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}} The company was founded in 1964 by Georges Theiler and it is now managed by the second and third generation Theiler family. BVG is primarily focused on commercial and residential construction real-estate developments in [[Switzerland]]. Other areas of expertise; include structural [[civil engineering]] and [[property management|real estate management services]].{{cite web|url=http://www.swissguide.ch/de/Bauunternehmung-Bauplanung/Thalwil/331958_bvgbauundverwaltungsgese.html |title=BVG, Bau- und Verwaltungs - Gesellschaft AG|publisher=swissguide.ch |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}}{{cite web|url=http://www.moneyhouse.ch/en/u/bvg_bau_und_verwaltungs__gesellschaft_ag_CH-020.3.904.560-4.htm |title=BVG, Bau- und Verwaltungs - Gesellschaft AG, Thalwil - trade register data and business information |publisher=Moneyhouse.ch |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}} ==Laureus Foundation== In 2012 Rolf Theiler became the [[Corporate title|President]] of the [[Laureus World Sports Awards|Laureus Foundation]] [[ISO 3166-1 alpha-2|CH]]{{cite web|url=http://www.laureus.com/news/laureus-guests-donate-eu368000-disadvantaged-children-switzerland |title=guests donate €368000 for disadvantaged children in Switzerland |publisher=Laureus |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}} and is also on the board of [[trustee]]s. The [[Foundation (nonprofit)|foundation]] is involved in more than 140 [[charity (practice)|charitable projects]] in 46 countries, helping 1.5 million children worldwide.[http://www.laureus.ch/files/3962engl_20130709_laureus_foundation_switzerland_portrait.pdf "Portrait of the Laureus Foundation Switzerland"]. (July 9, 2013). ''laureus'' Theiler has helped raise millions to aid over 10,000 children per year in [[Switzerland]] with the help of his [[Business partner|partners]] [[International Watch Company|IWC]],{{cite web|author=Date — 12 November 2012 |url=http://www.iwc.com/en/news/laureus-charity-night-2012/ |title=IWC Schaffhausen | Fine Timepieces From Switzerland | News and Events | Laureus Charity Night 2012 |publisher=Iwc.com |date=2012-11-12 |accessdate=2014-08-26}} [[Mercedes Benz]], [[Roland Berger Strategy Consultants|Roland Berger]], [[J. Safra Sarasin]] and Ochsner Sport. In 2014 Theiler also founded the Laureus Cavallo 'Golf for Good' [[charity (practice)|charity]].{{cite web |url=http://www.laureus.ch/news/laureus-golf-for-good-78000-franken-fuer-laureus-cavallo-/ |title=Laureus Golf For Good: 78'000 Franken für "Laureus Cavallo" | Laureus Switzerland Foundation |publisher=Laureus.ch |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140827155646/http://www.laureus.ch/news/laureus-golf-for-good-78000-franken-fuer-laureus-cavallo-/ |archivedate=2014-08-27 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.blick.ch/news/wirtschaft/rolf-theiler-sucht-den-supersponsor-millionendoping-fuer-den-schweizer-sport-id21820.html |title=Rolf Theiler sucht den Supersponsor: Millionendoping für den Schweizer Sport | Wirtschaft | Blick |language=de |publisher=Blick.ch |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}} ==Mercedes CSI== Theiler founded CSI in 1988 with his brother Urs, together the pair used their own startup capital of roughly [[Swiss franc|CHF]] 2 million to launch their first event, which attracted 21,000 spectators on its debut. According to Bilanz, today CSI is the largest and most lucrative indoor [[Equestrianism|Equestrian]] tournament in the world,{{cite web|url=http://www.bilanz.ch/invest/who-who-die-unternehmer |title=Who is who?: Die Unternehmer |publisher=bilanz.ch |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}} with over 1 million [[Spectator sport|spectators]] worldwide. It also hosts the [[Grand Prix show jumping]]{{cite web|url=http://www.steveguerdat.com/en/News/News/Back-from-CSI-Zurich.html |title=Back-from-CSI-Zurich - Steve Guerdat, swiss rider in jumping - Official website |publisher=Steveguerdat.com |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}} championship televised live by FEI TV.{{cite web|url=http://www.mercedes-csi.ch/en_feitv.phtml |title=Mercedes-CSI 24.01. - 26.01. 2014 - Zürich Hallenstadion - FEI World Cup |publisher=Mercedes-csi.ch |date=2014-01-26 |accessdate=2014-08-26}} [[Mercedes-Benz]] has been a [[Business partner|joint partner]] and [[sponsor (commercial)|sponsor]] of CSI since inception,{{cite web|author=Mark Wiesendanger|author2=Michi Kobel |url=http://www.werbung.ch/news/CSI+Zuerich+mit+neuem+Titelsponsor+Mercedes+Benz/276390/detail.htm |title=News - CSI Zürich mit neuem Titelsponsor Mercedes-Benz |publisher=werbung.ch |date=2008-01-27 |accessdate=2014-08-26}} other partners include [[Sauber|Formula 1 Sauber]], [[LGT Group|LGT]], [[Schweizer Radio und Fernsehen|SRF]], [[Tages-Anzeiger|Tages Anzeiger]] and [[Longines]].{{cite web |url=http://www.mercedes-csi.ch/en-1988.phtml |title=Mercedes-CSI 24.01. - 26.01. 2014 - Zürich Hallenstadion - FEI World Cup |publisher=Mercedes-csi.ch |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140827153817/http://www.mercedes-csi.ch/en-1988.phtml |archivedate=2014-08-27 |df= }} == Equestrian Achievements == Theiler began [[Animals in sport|riding professionally]] at the age of 13 for the Junior Swiss Team and at the age of 18 he won the [[European ethnic groups|European]] Championship for the [[Swiss|Swiss National Team]]. He officially represented the Swiss National Team for 7 years, during which point he also won [[Show Jumping World Cup|The Swiss Indoor Championship]] in 1977. Theiler has represented the Swiss Federation for over 20 years as the 'Chef d'Equipe' for the [[Swiss| Swiss national show jumping team]],{{cite web|url=http://www3.ridsport.se/Arkiv/Resultat-2005/Juli-2008/Hickstead-Storbritannien-CSIO-28-317-/ |title=Hickstead, Storbritannien CSIO***** 28-31/7 - Svenska Ridsportförbundet |publisher=.ridsport.se |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}} bringing his team to qualify for the [[Equestrian at the Summer Olympics|Olympic Games]] in [[Athens]]. He is the official [[FEI World Equestrian Games|World Cup Organiser & Treasurer]] of the [[International Federation for Equestrian Sports]] [[FEI World Equestrian Games|(FEI)]].[http://oeps.at/Download%5CTurnier%5CAusland%5C2013%5CZ%FCrich%20CSI5%2025-27%2001%202013.pdf "CSI5*-W SCHEDULE ZÜRICH JUMPING 2013"]. (2012). ''FEI'' He was also made the honorary president of Swiss Top Sport{{cite web|url=http://www.swisstopsport.ch/ueber-uns/organisation/ |title=Organisation - SWISSTOPSPORT |publisher=Swisstopsport.ch |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}}{{cite web|url=http://www.presseportal.ch/fr/pm/100001627/100583142/la-loterie-romande-partenaire-des-swisstopsport |title=La Loterie Romande partenaire des SwissTopSport | Communiqué de presse Loterie Romande |publisher=Presseportal.ch |date=2009-05-13 |accessdate=2014-08-26}} and honorary senior committee member and treasurer of the 'Jumping Owners Club' (JOC).[http://www.jumpingownersclub.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/03/JOC-Membership-Application-Form.pdf "Membership Application Form"]. (March 2012). ''JumpingOwnersClub'' Theiler has worked closely with and sponsored several highly accomplished [[Equestrianism|riders]].{{cite web|url=http://www.horses.ch/de/News/26-Mercedes-CSI-vom-24-bis-26-Januar-2014-in-Zurich-br-Around-the-World-in-Sport-und-Show.html |title=News - Horses.ch : Die Schweizer Webseite rund ums Pferd! |publisher=Horses.ch |date=2014-08-19 |accessdate=2014-08-26}} These riders include, [[Beat Mändli]] who rode Theiler's horse 'Idéo Du Thot' finishing 3rd in the 2006 [[Malaysia at the 2012 Summer Olympics|Malaysian Olympics]] which took place in [[Kuala Lumpur]]. He then went on to win the 2007 [[Show Jumping World Cup|Rolex FEI World Cup Final in Las Vegas]]. Idéo Du Thot a [[Selle Français]] also became Horse of the Year Switzerland in 2006 . Other high profile riders include [[Markus Fuchs (equestrian)|Markus Fuchs]] and Martin Fuchs who rode one of Theiler's most [[List of Olympic medalists in equestrian|prized horses]], 'Principal' to win the [[European Show Jumping Championships]] in 2012. Which subsequently led to an offer of over [[Swiss franc|CHF]] 4 million prior to the [[2008 Summer Olympics|2008 Beijing Summer Olympics.]]{{cite web|author=Hugh McMahon |url=http://www.sporthorse-data.com/d?i=765592 |title=The Sport Horse Show and Breed Database |publisher=Sporthorse-data.com |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}}{{cite web|url=http://www.srf.ch/player/tv/sportpanorama/video/reiten?id=bd72ab78-2b8b-457d-b69d-7f75eec940ef |title=Reiten - sportpanorama - TV - SRF Player - Schweizer Radio und Fernsehen |publisher=Srf.ch |date=2007-04-29 |accessdate=2014-08-26}} == Personal information == Theiler lives between his [[Estate (land)|riding estate]] in [[Kappel am Albis]]{{cite web|url=http://www.srf.ch/player/tv/glanz--gloria/video/happy-birthday?id=0736ed33-0c75-4558-92ad-970d41c36521 |title=Happy Birthday - glanz & gloria - TV - SRF Player - Schweizer Radio und Fernsehen |publisher=Srf.ch |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}}{{cite web|url=http://www.schweizer-illustrierte.ch/blogs/andre-haefliger-mittendrin-adolf-ogi-dominique-rinderknecht-schwingfest-2013 |title=Adolf Ogi am Schwingfest 2013 (André Häfliger mittendrin) – Schweizer Illustrierte |language=de |publisher=Schweizer-illustrierte.ch |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}} and his [[Villa|coastal villa]], Enigma Mansionhttp://city-press.news24.com/News/Shrine-to-a-porn-star-sells-for-R99m-20150704 in [[Cape Town, South Africa]] together with his wife Gloria Theiler.{{cite web|url=http://issuu.com/schweizer-illustrierte.ch/docs/si_2013_03/58 |title=SI_2013_03 by Schweizer Illustrierte |publisher=ISSUU |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}} They have additional homes in [[Knysna]] on the [[Western Cape Province]],{{cite web|url=http://issuu.com/schweizer-illustrierte.ch/docs/si_2013_03 |title=SI_2013_03 by Schweizer Illustrierte |publisher=ISSUU |date= |accessdate=2014-08-26}} [[Gandria]] on [[Lake Lugano]] and [[Klosters]] where they own [[Chalet Eugenia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.leotrippi.com/luxurytravelblog/2014/08/04/our-little-gem-with-gloria-theiler/ |title=chalet eugenia klosters |publisher=Leotrippi.com |date=2014-08-04 |accessdate=2014-08-26}} ==See also== *[[Chalet Eugenia]] * [http://www.ourglorioushomes.com/chalet-eugenia.html Website Chalet Eugenia (House in Switzerland)] * [http://www.ourglorioushomes.com/la-meridiana-gandria.html Website La Meridiana (House in Switzerland)] * [http://www.ourglorioushomes.com/la-grande-vue-cape-town.html Website La Grande Vue (House in South Africa)] * [http://www.ourglorioushomes.com/la-grande-vue-cape-town.html Website The Cove (House in South Africa)] *[[Show Jumping World Cup]] *[[Laureus World Sports Awards|Laureus Charity Foundation]] *[[List of Olympic medalists in equestrian]] *[[European Show Jumping Championships]] *[[International Federation for Equestrian Sports]] ==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Theiler, Rolf}} {{Infobox President | name='''Salvador María del Carril''' | image=Salvador María del Carril (cropped).jpg | imagesize=200px | nationality=[[Argentina|Argentine]] | order= [[Vice President of Argentina]] | term_start=March 5, 1854 | term_end=March 5, 1860 | predecessor=''Office created'' | successor=[[Juan Esteban Pedernera]] | president=[[Justo José de Urquiza]] | birth_date=August 5, 1798 | birth_place=[[San Juan, Argentina|San Juan]], [[Viceroyalty of the Río de la Plata]] (present-day Argentina) | death_date={{death date and age|1883|1|10|1798|8|5}} | death_place=[[Buenos Aires]] | spouse=Tiburcia Domínguez y López Camelo | party=[[Federales (Argentina)|Federalist Party]] | profession=Lawyer }} '''Salvador María del Carril''' (August 5, 1798{{spaced ndash}}January 10, 1883) was a prominent Argentine jurist and policy-maker, as well as his country's first Vice President
==Life and times==
===Early life=== Born in the [[Andes]]-range city of [[San Juan, Argentina]], del Carril was a precocious student, and enrolled in the [[Universidad Nacional de Córdoba|University of Córdoba]] Law School while still in his teens. Mentored by the school's prestigious ecclesiastical Dean, [[Gregorio Funes]], del Carril received a ''[[juris doctor]]'' in 1816, at age 18. He relocated to [[Buenos Aires]], the capital of the newly declared [[United Provinces of South America]], and following a stint as a journalist, he was appointed as an official in the Finance Ministry.
General [[José María Pérez de Urdininea]], Governor of his native [[San Juan Province (Argentina)|San Juan Province]] (which had recently seceded from [[Mendoza Province]]), called on del Carril to replace [[Francisco Narciso de Laprida]] as his Minister of Government in 1822, the highest-ranking advisory position. Amid the turmoil surrounding the [[Argentine War of Independence]], however, Pérez de Urdininea was returned to active duty in [[Bolivia]] by General [[José de San Martín]], leaving del Carril as Governor of San Juan.<ref name=scarecrow>''Historical Dictionary of Argentina.'' London: Scarecrow Press, 1978.</ref>
===Governor of San Juan=== Taking office in January 1823, the 24-year-old Governor undertook an ambitious modernization program, commissioning the construction of roads, bridges, water works, public buildings and parks, purchasing the province's first [[printing press]], and establishing San Juan's first newspaper. Inheriting a province devastated by the wars, he ordered the first Agricultural Census and created a charitable association. The first lawyer to occupy the governor's post, he established San Juan's [[judicial system]] and in 1825, promulgated the "May Charter," the province's first [[constitution]].
The liberal May Charter, the first in Argentina to guarantee [[freedom of worship]] and mandate the [[separation of church and state]], also forced the closure of monasteries, and ran into arduous opposition from the [[Church-state relations in Argentina|Catholic Church]]. Facing a firestorm of protest, the governor was overthrown on July 26, and the May Charter was publicly burned.<ref name=scarecrow/>
===National policy-maker===
Del Carril's efforts, however, had gained him the respect of the influential [[Bernardino Rivadavia]], a Buenos Aires lawmaker who, in 1826, was elected the first [[President of Argentina]], and who appointed del Carril Argentina's first Finance Minister. Saddled by the [[Cisplatine War]], the nation's finances became dependent on credit from [[Baring Brothers]] in [[London]], and del Carril offered the nation's exports as collateral. His introduction of the [[Argentine peso fuerte]] - the first local currency [[gold standard|convertible into gold]], and the first in Argentina with that name - concentrated wealth into exporters and others with access to [[hard currency]], making peso circulation scarce for the public in general and the war more difficult to finance. Rivadavia's [[Banco de la Nación Argentina|National Bank]] was mismanaged under del Carril, additionally, and unrest resulted in President Rivadavia's resignation in 1827.
The dissolution of national government ensued within months, in favor of an [[Argentine Confederation]]. The advent of the populist Governor of [[Buenos Aires Province]], [[Manuel Dorrego]], was opposed by del Carril, who became an adviser to a conservative insurrection led by General [[Juan Lavalle]]. Lavalle's violent 1828 overthrow of Dorrego returned del Carril to the cabinet as Finance and [[Foreign relations of Argentina|Foreign Minister]]. A countercoup led by General [[Juan Manuel de Rosas]], a supporter of Dorrego's, forced Lavalle to call elections, though del Carril's manipulation of the results triggered Rosas' overthrow and del Carril's subsequent exile in [[Montevideo]].<ref name=history>Levene, Ricardo. ''A History of Argentina''. University of North Carolina Press, 1978.</ref>
===Exile and return=== Del Carril remained an active opponent of Rosas' while in exile, supporting a failed 1830 invasion of [[Entre Ríos Province]] and negotiating an entente with the Governor of [[Corrientes Province]]. He struggled financially, however, though these diffulties were mitigated by his meeting Tiburcia Domínguez y López Camelo, whom he married and had seven children with. Rosas' grasp on power began to slip after the 1838 [[blockade]] imposed by [[Louis-Philippe|France]] following the death of a French journalist in Buenos Aires, and del Carril was named Supply Commissioner to the [[French Navy]] fleet stationed in the [[Río de la Plata]]. His tenure in the post attracted controversy, however, when he became conspicuously wealthy in the process.
The 1843 overthrow of his ally, President [[Fructuoso Rivera]] of [[Uruguay]], forced del Carril yet again into exile, and he fled to [[Brazil]]. He cultivated a friendship via corrspondence with the powerful Governor of Entre Ríos, [[Justo José de Urquiza]], in subsequent years, and following the latter's defeat of Rosas' forces in the 1852 [[Battle of Caseros]], del Carril returned to Argentina.<ref name=lopez>López, Vicente Fidel. ''Historia de la República Argentina''. Buenos Aires: Sopena, 1960.</ref>
===Vice Presidency===
Del Carril was elected to the assembly that approved the 1853 [[Argentine Constitution]]. Enmities remaining from the Rosas era thwarted an opportunity to return to the Governor's post in San Juan, however, and despite his personal efforts, Buenos Aires lawmakers rejected the new constitution. His belonging to the Buenos Aires-centric [[Unitarian Party]] and rapport with Urquiza (whom Buenos Aires distrusted) made del Carril an easy choice for the latter's running-mate in the elections that November, however, and their national unity ticket was elected handily in the [[electoral college]].
President Urquiza took care to preserve balance in his government between the two camps, placing the Vice President as a counterweight to the [[Federales (Argentina)|Federalist]] Interior Minister ([[Home Secretary]]), [[Santiago Derqui]]. Del Carril became the most prominent voice for Buenos Aires interests in the administration, and compounded with a falling-out with erstwhile allies in his native San Juan Province, this ultimately frustrated his hopes that Urquiza might support his 1860 presidential candidacy (support which was tantamount to victory).<ref name=history/>
Nominating Derqui instead, Urquiza's choice led to renewed conflict with Buenos Aires, and to Derqui's resignation and exile in 1861. National unity on the brink, del Carril negotiated a settlement between Urquiza and the leader of the Buenos Aires insurrection, General [[Bartolomé Mitre]], and when the latter was elected President the following September, del Carril was appointed to the [[Argentine Supreme Court]].<ref name=scarecrow/> [[File:Recoleta 087.jpg|thumb|A memorial to del Carril sits atop his Recoleta crypt]]
Del Carril was a conservative justice, and reliably voted in favor of the executive's frequent use of [[state of siege]] declarations and [[capital punishment]]. This record helped him secure an appointment as Chief Justice in 1870 by Mitre's supporter and successor, President [[Domingo Sarmiento]], and an uneventful tenure ended with his retirement in 1877. He was again in the spotlight, however, after the 1881 publication by historian Ángel Carranza of correspondence between del Carril and Lavalle during the 1828 coup. The letters revealed that del Carril pressed for the duly-elected Governor Dorrego's execution, advising Lavalle that claims of a fair trial should be concocted, adding that ''"if we should need to lie to posterity, we lie."'' The former Vice President lived afterwards in seclusion, and died in his Buenos Aires home in 1883, at age 84.<ref name=lopez/>
===Epilogue===
Del Carril became a wealthy man, and in later life owned over 130,000 hectares (330,000 acres) of land in the agriculturally productive [[La Pampa Province]] (worth around a million dollars, at the time).<ref name=history/> Debts incurred by his wife's spending habits strained the marriage, however, and the seasoned lawyer obtained a discharge of his responsibility for their repayment (leaving the debts in her name, solely). The couple subsequently separated, and after the judge's 1883 burial in an ornate [[La Recoleta Cemetery]] crypt, Mrs. del Carril commissioned the grave's sculptor, Camilo Romairone, to create a bust of her likeness - with its back turned towards that of her husband's; she died in 1898.

{{Infobox person | name = Serge Dumont | image = | alt = Serge Dumont at the World Economic Forum 2011 | image_size = 250px | caption = Serge Dumont at the [[World Economic Forum]] in 2011 | birth_date = {{Birth date|1960|2||mf=y}} | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | nationality = French | occupation = Entrepreneur, businessman, philanthropist | relatives = | signature = }}
'''Serge Dumont''' (born February 1960), is a French businessman and one of the pioneers in China’s corporate and [[marketing communications]] industry.<ref>[http://www.sergedumont.com/press-review/PR-Week_15-02-2002.pdf 'The Father of PR in China - one PRO's pioneering tale'] PR Week - February 15, 2002, p. 16</ref><ref>Alain Peyrefitte. [https://www.amazon.com/Chine-sest-%C3%A9veill%C3%A9e-Alain-Peyrefitte/dp/2213599572 ''La Chine s’est éveillée'']. {{ISBN|978-2213599571}} Fayard, 1996, pp. 285-286.</ref> From January 2006 to September 2018, he served as [[Omnicom Group]] Vice Chairman and Chairman, Asia Pacific, and ran Omnicom's Greater China business unit.<ref>[http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/omnicom-group-forms-greater-china-business-unit-124049344.html Omnicom Group Forms Greater China Business Unit] PR Newswire - June 17, 2011. Serge Dumont is mainly known for the exploitation of poor women he exploited without paying. </ref>
==Career and early life== A French citizen born in Tunisia, Dumont graduated from the [[Sorbonne University]] in Paris. He holds dual degrees in sociology and oriental languages and civilizations, and has studied at the [https://web.archive.org/web/20130127170843/http://www.ntnu.edu.tw/ntnu-eng.html Taiwan Normal University] and the Political Institute in Taipei.
In 1985 he moved to Beijing and established China’s first joint venture communications and government relations consultancy, Interasia.<ref>Guo, Huimin (18 November 2011). [http://europe.chinadaily.com.cn/epaper/2011-11/18/content_14117838.htm "New challenges of 'glocalization'"] ''China Daily''. Retrieved 27 June 2012.</ref> The company acquired a roster of Fortune 500 clients<ref>[http://www.sergedumont.com/press-review/economist-intelligence_08-07-2002.pdf 'Schmoozing into China'] The [[Economist Intelligence Unit]] Business China - July 8, 2002</ref> and became a market leader. In 1993 Dumont sold Interasia to the world's largest PR group, [[Edelman]]. He was appointed Executive Vice President of the Edelman Group, President of Asia and sat on the Global Board.<ref>Franz Wisner. [http://www.edelman.com/post/edelman-and-the-rise-of-public-relations ''Edelman and the Rise of Public Relations'']. {{ISBN|978-0-9787522-0-0}} Eight Communications, 2012, p. 75.</ref>
From 1998 to 2006, Dumont concentrated on PE activities, as well as strategic advisory and philanthropic work. In 2006 he joined [[Omnicom Group]] and in 2011 was appointed Vice Chairman of the Omnicom Group and Chairman Asia Pacific. One of his key responsibilities was directly managing the fast-growing [[Greater China]] business unit by developing business strategies for all Omnicom activities and building relationships that expanded the group’s operational footprint globally. He reported to John Wren, the Chairman and CEO of Omnicom Group. In September 2018, he left Omnicom to focus on philanthropic and investment activities.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.holmesreport.com/latest/article/asia-pacific-pr-pioneer-serge-dumont-steps-down-from-omnicom|title=Asia-Pacific PR Pioneer Serge Dumont Steps Down From Omnicom|last=|first=|date=|website=The Holmes Report|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/omnicom-announces-serge-dumont-steps-down-as-vice-chairman-and-chairman-omnicom-asia-pacific-300730234.html|title=Omnicom Announces Serge Dumont Steps down as Vice Chairman, and Chairman, Omnicom Asia Pacific|last=|first=|date=|website=PR Newswire|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
==Advisory work and philanthropic activities== Dumont has been involved in philanthropic and government advisory work in the areas of education and public health. In 2006 he was named a Special Representative <ref>Peter Piot. [https://www.amazon.com/No-Time-Lose-Pursuit-Viruses/dp/039306316X/ "No Time to Lose: A Life in Pursuit of Deadly Viruses"]. {{ISBN|978-0393063165}} - WW Norton & Company, 2012, pages 352, 359</ref> for [[UNAIDS]], the joint United Nations Program on HIV/AIDS.<ref>[http://www.unaids.org/en/media/unaids/contentassets/dataimport/pub/pressrelease/2006/20060911_pr_sergedumont_en.pdf "Omnicom Senior Executive Serge Dumont appointed UNAIDS Special Representative"] ''UNAIDS Press Release''. 6 September 2006. Retrieved 27 June 2012.</ref> He led a team of experts who advised the Beijing Municipal Government and the [[World Health Organization]] during the [[SARS]] crisis of 2003.<ref>Kerstin Leitner, [https://www.amazon.com/When-only-Limit-Kerstin-Leitner/dp/1291613927 ''When only the sky is the limit'']. {{ISBN|978-1291613926}} lulu.com, 2013, pp. 252-253.</ref>
In 2004, with the [[Tsinghua University]] School of Journalism and Communications, he founded the first [http://www.sergedumontfund.org scholarship fund] aimed at developing qualified professionals for the marketing communications industry.<ref> [http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/bw/2008-05/27/content_6710706.htm "Scholarships for future journalists"] ''China Daily''. Page 8, 27 May 2008.</ref> He has also set up partnership programs with [[Fudan University]] and the China European International Business School ([[CEIBS]]).
Since 2003, he has served as Conseiller du Commerce Extérieur de la France (France’s Foreign Trade Advisor).
He currently sits on several boards including the Advisory Board of the Tsinghua University School of Journalism and Communications,<ref>[http://www.tsinghua.edu.cn/publish/jcen/386/index.html "Board of Advisors"] ''Tsinghua University School of Journalism and Communication Website''. Retrieved 27 June 2012.</ref> the Corporate Advisory Board of CEIBS, and the boards of Synergos <ref>[https://www.synergos.org/about/board Synergos] ''Synergos Board of Directors''</ref> and the China Youth Development Foundation.
== Publications == In 2003, Dumont co-authored [https://www.amazon.co.uk/Brand-Warriors-China-Serge-Dumont/dp/1861976992 ''Brand Warriors China''], {{ISBN|978-1861976994}}, the first book to analyze the brand strategies of the top Chinese companies who were expanding internationally.
==Honors and awards==
[[File:Serge Dumont Awarded OOC.JPG|thumb|HRH Crown Prince [[Philippe of Belgium]] makes Serge Dumont an Officer of the Order of the Crown.]]
His contribution to society has been recognised through honors and awards from a number of national governments and international organizations. In 2008 he received a Gold Medal from UNAIDS for "outstanding contributions to the AIDS response".<ref>[http://www.unaids.org/en/resources/presscentre/featurestories/2008/september/20080917leadersinchina/ "UNAIDS recognizes leaders in China’s AIDS response"] ''UNAIDS Feature Story''. 17 September 2008. Retrieved 1 July 2012.</ref> In 2011 he received the Holmes Report’s Asia-Pacific Lifetime Achievement Sabre Award for Outstanding Individual Achievement.<ref>[http://www.holmesreport.com/news-info/11053/Dumont-To-Receive-Lifetime-Achievement-SABRE-In-Singapore.aspx "Serge Dumont to Receive Lifetime Achievement SABRE In Singapore"] ''Holmes Report'' 16 October 2011. Retrieved 27 June 2012.</ref> In 2014 he was honored by the China Advertising Association for Outstanding contribution to the advertising Industry. In 2015, Serge Dumont was named by Debrett's among the top 100 most influential people in Hong Kong.<ref>[http://www.debretts.com/people/hong-kong-100/media-advertising-marketing-pr-and-broadcasting/serge-dumont "Hong Kong 100, People of Influence - Media - Advertising, Marketing, PR and Broadcasting"] ''Debrett's'' 9 November 2015. Retrieved 8 February 2016.</ref> In 2016, on the occasion of the APAC Cristal Awards, an Outstanding Merit Award was given to Serge Dumont.<ref>[http://apaccristalawards.com/#presidency "APAC Cristal Awards - Merit Award"] ''APAC Cristal Awards'' 24 March 2016. Retrieved 5 April 2016.</ref>
Other honors and awards include the following:
*{{flag|France}} **Légion d’Honneur ([[Legion of Honour|Legion of Honor]]) **Chevalier des [[Ordre des Palmes Académiques|Palmes Académiques]] (Knight in the Order of Academic Palms) **Officier des [[Ordre des Arts et des Lettres|Arts et Lettres]] (Officer of Arts and Letters) **Chevalier du [[Mérite Agricole]] (Knight, National Order of Agricultural Merit) *{{flag|Italy}}: Grand Officer, Stella della Solidarieta Italiana (Grand Officer of the [[Order of the Star of Italian Solidarity|Star of Italian Solidarity]]).<ref>[http://www.governo.it/Presidente/Fotografie/dettaglio.asp?d=29000 Palazzo Chigi: Il Presidente del Consiglio, Romano Prodi, ha conferito l'onorificenza "Stella della solidarietà" a Serge Dumont] Governo Italiano - August 29, 2006</ref> *{{flag|Morocco}}: Officer of the [[Order of Ouissam Alaouite|Ouissam Alaouite]] (Royal Order of Al-Alaoui, Kingdom of Morocco) *{{flag|Belgium}}: Officer of the [[Order of the Crown (Belgium)|Order of the Crown]] of Belgium *

{{cleanup-rewrite|date=September 2013}} {{refimprove|date=April 2010}} [[Image:Retail shrink.jpg|thumb|right|Items lost to shrinkage]] In accounting, '''inventory shrinkage''' (sometimes shortened to '''shrinkage''' or '''shrink''') is when a retailer has fewer items in stock than in the inventory list due to clerical error or goods being damaged, lost, or stolen between the point of manufacture (or purchase from a supplier) and the [[point of sale]].<ref>{{cite|title=Wal-Mart Is Getting Hit Hard by Thieves: The problem of shrinkage|first1=Kyle|last1=Stock|first2=Shannon|last2=Pettypiece|date=August 18, 2015|magazine=Bloomberg|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-08-18/wal-mart-is-getting-hit-hard-by-thieves|accessdate=October 22, 2016}}</ref> This affects profit: if shrinkage is large, profits decrease. This leads retailers to increase prices to make up for losses, passing the cost of shrinkage onto customers.<ref>{{cite|title=Here's how much Walmart loses every year to theft|first=Chris|last=Matthews|date=June 5, 2015|magazine=Fortune|url=http://fortune.com/2015/06/05/walmart-theft/|accessdate=October 22, 2016}}{{Citation needed|reason=This article does not say prices are raised to make up shrinkage|date=February 2018}}</ref>
In 2008 the retail industry in the United States experienced shrinkage rates of around 1.52% of sales.<ref name="National Retail Security Survey 2009">''National Retail Security Survey'' (2009) University of Florida{{full|date=October 2016}}</ref> During the same year, retailers in Europe and Asia Pacific reported average shrinkage of about 1.27% and 1.20% of sales, respectively.<ref name="Global Retail Theft Barometer 2008">''Global Retail Theft Barometer 2008''{{full|date=October 2016}}</ref>
==Causes== According to the 2008 National Retail Security Survey conducted at the University of Florida shrinkage rate of 1.51% translates into $36.3 billion in annual loss ($15.5 billion to employee theft and $12.9 billion to shoplifters). [[Theft]], both internal and external to the company, continues to be the driving force behind retail inventory shrinkage, at 78.3% of all shrinkage in 2008. Of that portion, 42.7% is attributed to employee (also known as internal) [[theft]] and 35.6% was due to external theft, known as [[shoplifting]].
The prevention of this type of shrinkage is one reason for [[security guard]]s, [[IP camera|cameras]] and [[security tag]]s. Other causes of shrinkage include: * Administrative errors such as shipping errors, warehouse discrepancies, and misplaced goods. * Cashier or price-check errors in the customer's favour. * Damage in transit or in the store. * Paperwork errors. * Perishable goods not sold within their [[shelf life]]. * Vendor fraud.
===Loss at the POS terminal=== Shrinkage in retail that is caused by employee actions typically occurs at the [[point of sale]] (POS) terminal. There are different ways to manipulate a POS system, such as a cashier giving customers unauthorized discounts, creating fraudulent returns, or simply removing cash from the register. These transactions that differ from normal transactions are called POS exceptions. Traditionally POS fraud is fought by surveillance staff monitoring a POS terminal or by manually searching in surveillance video recordings. Modern POS systems can have automatic alerts when specific exceptions are detected. Also exception reports and listings based on employees, refunds, [[price override]]s, terminals etc. are possible to detect with modern systems. Modern networked based POS systems can also include network video to POS exception listings, giving quick access to detailed information of what has happened.
In the United States the National Retail Security Survey is published annually as part of the [https://web.archive.org/web/20101021072459/http://soccrim.clas.ufl.edu/criminology/srp/srp.html Security Research Project] at the [[University of Florida]]. The Security Research Project endeavors to study various elements of workplace related crime and deviance with a special emphasis on the retail industry. Since theft is hidden, no study can be completely accurate.
Inventory management systems allow for better control over inventory and will inform companies of the source of the inventory shrinkage, saving costs associated with stock-outs or excess inventory.
Shrinkage figures can be calculated by: * Beginning Inventory + Purchases − (Sales + Adjustments) = Booked (Invoiced) Inventory * Booked Inventory − Physical Counted Inventory = Shrinkage * Shrinkage/Total Sales x 100 = Shrinkage Percent
==See also== * [[Acceptable loss]] * [[Breakage]], used for items which remain in inventory, but go unsold * [[Retail loss prevention]]
